qas.question: In what year did Sony take BMG's half stake in the company?
Name one of the final albums to ever have the Sony BMG label?

answers.text: Thriller 25 by Michael Jackson, I Am... Sasha Fierce by Beyoncé, Keeps Gettin' Better: A Decade of Hits by Christina Aguilera, and Safe Trip Home by Dido

qas.question: When was Sony's new logo revealed to the public?

plausible_answers.text: Thriller 25 by Michael Jackson, I Am... Sasha Fierce by Beyoncé, Keeps Gettin' Better: A Decade of Hits by Christina Aguilera, and Safe Trip Home by Dido

qas.question: The first few albums to feature a Sony BMG logo were?
A permanent logo was unveiled on December 1 of what year?
The present logo was unveiled in December of what year?
Bertelsmann acquired Sony's 50% stake on what date?

context: On August 5, <a0_0>2008<a0_0/>, SCA and Bertelsmann announced that Sony had agreed to acquire Bertelsmann's 50% stake in Sony BMG. Sony completed its acquisition of Bertelsmann's 50% stake in the companies' joint venture on <b6_0>October 1, 2008<b6_0/>. The company, once again named Sony Music Entertainment Inc., became a wholly owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation through its US subsidiary SCA. The last few albums to feature a Sony BMG logo were <a1_0><b3_0>Thriller 25 by Michael Jackson, I Am... Sasha Fierce by Beyoncé, Keeps Gettin' Better: A Decade of Hits by Christina Aguilera, and Safe Trip Home by Dido<b3_0/><a1_0/>. A temporary logo was unveiled beginning December 1, <b4_0><b5_0>2008<b5_0/><b4_0/>. The present logo was unveiled in March <a2_0>2009<a2_0/>.
